Posts.Content: Hi, I got the phone number of the local breast scan department and phoned up for a scan myself. I am over 50 though. My scan was clear but I had an ultrasound and biopsy which showed up positive for cancer. Good luck.
Posts.Title: Should I get a second opinion??

Posts.Content: Hi, I got the phone number of the local breast scan department and phoned up for a scan myself. I am over 50 though. My scan was clear but I had an ultrasound and biopsy which showed up positive for cancer. Good luck.
Posts.Title: Should I get a second opinion??

Posts.Content: Hi, I had a left mastectomy and a right reduction, with no reconstruction. About 10 days ago now. I did have a 36 g. I am very pleased with my new little breast, now 36 c.  It will certainly change my life for the better. I am happy to wear a prothesis. I have recovered well but the exercises are a pain. No infections or seromas. The lymph node clearance under my arm is very stiff but the exercises help with that. The lymph node clearance is the worst bit for me. I didn't want a reconstruction, it's a personal choice I think. I want the fastest recovery possible. Hope that helps. Mo
Posts.Title: Advice Please....Reconstruction or Not??

Posts.Content: Hi, I start next week​ as well. I had my new starters appointment today, have you had one of those. The side affects sound very bad but I am hoping not to get any lol. I had my opp 5 weeks ago now, just starting to feel stronger.
Posts.Title: Starting chemo!!

Posts.Content: Hi, I start next week​ as well. I had my new starters appointment today, have you had one of those. The side affects sound very bad but I am hoping not to get any lol. I had my opp 5 weeks ago now, just starting to feel stronger.
Posts.Title: Starting chemo!!

Posts.Content: Hi, I am so glad you have raised this issue. I was feeling so panicky, it can be overwhelming at times. I had my first counselling session last week. It was organised my Macmillan.  I feel a lot better now I have voiced my fears. It has helped me and I feel a lot calmer as a result.  I was finding hard to keep busy as I am recovering from surgery. So I have a lot of time to fill.  I have had Counselling before and I also found that painting abstract paintings help me as well. I just paint randomly​. I know this is a bit out there but I thought I would mention it as it helped me. Having this web site also helps.
Posts.Title: Books on anxiety and Fear please

Posts.Content: Hi, Feeling slightly better this morning, and I slept a bit last night,  you lot are inspirational, well done for getting through 3 lots of FEC, I think you just have to take one day at a time, this web site is getting me through it, thank you all for being here, mo x
Posts.Title: Sickness Durung Chemo FEC

Posts.Content: Hi, I've only had one cycle and I feel like giving up, I'm not sleeping and I feel sick all the time, I was sick again this morning, I have a horrible taste in my mouth, it's very hard to eat anything, feeling really fed up with it all. I am glad to hear that there is no sickness with the t part though.
Posts.Title: Sickness Durung Chemo FEC

Posts.Content: Hi, has anyone any tips for getting some relief from this cardboard mouth thing?
Posts.Title: Sickness Durung Chemo FEC

Posts.Content: Hi, just saw your post, I am awake as well, try the AWAKE thread, it's were all the people who can't sleep are. Cancer can be overwhelming at times. I just try to stay with it. It doesn't last for ever.
Posts.Title: Effects of chemo EC90

Posts.Content: Hi, thank you for responding,  Yes the fear of what is going to happen is sometimes more scary than when it actually happens.  I have already had surgery, I had a mastectomy and lymph nodes removal on the 6th july.  I like to keep my head in the sand as well, but then when I have an appointment its all a bit of a shock again.  What a PICC?  is that the line to put the chemo into your body?  Keep in touch.  Mo
Posts.Title: New chemo starter

Posts.Content: Hi, thanks for the hugs I need them, this is the sort of day that just get worse and worse, does everyone have to have one of those lines that has chemo. Just looked up my Nottingham prognostic index, it's shit!
Posts.Title: New chemo starter

Posts.Content: Hi, I just googled knitted knockers, they look great, thanks for telling us about them, can you get them in the UK?
Posts.Title: Bra problem

Posts.Content: Hi, just got back from my first appointment with oncologist, feeling very scared, I start chemo on 16th august, I am having FEC-T, any information from anyone who has had this would be great.
Posts.Title: New chemo starter

Posts.Content: Hi, Thank you all for your replies.  I have done the more up to date predictor, it does look better, its just all extremely scary,  I guess we are all individuals and I just need to do everything to make sure that I survive for as long as possible.  Had my CT scan yesterday, scary but it went ok.  Yes we do seem to have very similar stories Bex.  I also had a left mastectomy, no reconstruction though, 18 lymph nodes removed, 9 positive, and I had my right breast reduced at the same time, I thought it might  help with wearing a prosthesis, and it does help. I have my new starter appointment this Friday,  With regard's to the thingy line I think I would prefer never to even see a needle again but I guess we all feel the same.  lol,    Thanks again for all your replies.  Mo x
Posts.Title: New chemo starter

Posts.Content: Hi, I rang Macmillan up and they got a benefits advisor to speak to me. They where very good and know what you need to do. You can claim council tax benefit whilst you are ill. But speak to them as they can tell you about your specific circumstances.
Posts.Title: Macmillan grants

Posts.Content: Hi, my cancer nurse gave me a form to fill in for one. You could ask yours for one, I have to give it back to her once I have filled it in. Mo
Posts.Title: Macmillan grants

Posts.Content: Wow that's great news, which bank are you with? Maybe they all have to do that, I have overdrawn last month as well and was expecting bank charges.
Posts.Title: Macmillan grants

Posts.Content: Hi, thank you all so much for your comments, it has helped a lot to read about your experiences. I don't feel so alone now. I think I do know what I want. I just thought that I needed to look at all my options before making a final choice. I am pre diabetic as well and I will have to loose another stone after surgery. I really want a B cup size but I am concerned that it will disappear when I loose another stone. Mo
Posts.Title: Advice on surgery

Posts.Content: Hi, I was diagnosed with lnvasive lobular cancer on 8th June. I am having a mastectomy on 6th July. I have to decide whether to have a reconstruction or not. I have large breasts, 36G so I am thinking of having a breast reduction of the other breast at the same time as I think this will help with wearing a prosthesis. Any advice would be appreciated, Mo
Posts.Title: Advice on surgery
